original: @84b #/ rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @84b #/ rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: dzambha la sto tra /
analyzed: dzambha la sto tra /
translated: Jambhalastotra

original: @85a * // bod skad du /
analyzed: @85a * // bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dzambha la'i bstod pa /
analyzed: dzambha la'i bstod pa /
translated: The Praise of Jambhala

original: dzambha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dzambha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Jambhala!

original: lha dang lha min dri za mi'am ci rnams kyi //
analyzed: lha dang lha min dri za mi'am ci rnams kyi //
translated: The crowns of gods, demigods, gandharvas, and kinnaras

original: cod pan 'od kyis zhabs kyi khri ni gsal mdzad pa //
analyzed: cod pan 'od kyis zhabs kyi khri ni gsal mdzad pa //
translated: are illuminated by the light from your feet.

original: byang chub mchog tu nges mdzad gnod sbyin dbang phyug la //
analyzed: byang chub mchog tu nges mdzad gnod sbyin dbang phyug la //
translated: To you, the lord of the yakshas, who is certain to attain supreme enlightenment,

original: sems can rnams la sman pa'i bsam pas bdag gis gsol //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sman pa'i bsam pas bdag gis gsol //
translated: I pray with the intention to benefit sentient beings.

original: gang zhig brtse ba'i bdag nyid byang chub sbyin mdzad khyod //
analyzed: gang zhig brtse ba'i bdag nyid byang chub sbyin mdzad khyod //
translated: You, who are compassionate by nature and bestow enlightenment,

original: snying rje'i rtsa ba sems can don du rab tu grags //
analyzed: snying rje'i rtsa ba sems can don du rab tu grags //
translated: are renowned for the root of compassion, which is the benefit of sentient beings.

original: mgon khyod sems can rnams la brtse bar mi mdzad na //
analyzed: mgon khyod sems can rnams la brtse bar mi mdzad na //
translated: O protector, if you do not show compassion to sentient beings,

original: khyod kyis sangs rgyas dran par gang gi 'gyur te 'tshal //游댷shin tu mi bzang dbul ba'i sdug bsngal nang du ni //
analyzed: khyod kyis sangs rgyas dran par gang gi 'gyur te 'tshal // shin tu mi bzang dbul ba'i sdug bsngal nang du ni //
translated: how could you remember the Buddha?游댷Have you not seen that beings have fallen

original: 'gro rnams lhung ba khyod kyis mthong bar ma gyur tam //
analyzed: 'gro rnams lhung ba khyod kyis mthong bar ma gyur tam //
translated: into the extremely unfortunate suffering of poverty?

original: rin chen gter chen rnams kyi mtshan nas bzung byas nas //
analyzed: rin chen gter chen rnams kyi mtshan nas bzung byas nas //
translated: Having taken up the names of the great treasures of jewels,

original: khyod kyis chu bo yang ni rdzing gis bcing bar mdzod //
analyzed: khyod kyis chu bo yang ni rdzing gis bcing bar mdzod //
translated: you should bind the rivers with dikes and reservoirs.

original: shin tu dbul pa'i byin za mi bzad drag po yis //
analyzed: shin tu dbul pa'i byin za mi bzad drag po yis //
translated: The terrible and unbearable poverty-demon

original: 'gro ba gang zhig nyin dang mtshan du sreg par byed //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang zhig nyin dang mtshan du sreg par byed //
translated: burns beings day and night.

original: brtse ba nyid kyis ser sna rnam par spong mdzod la //
analyzed: brtse ba nyid kyis ser sna rnam par spong mdzod la //
translated: Out of compassion, give up stinginess

original: rin chen bdud rtsi'i char gyi char rgyun drag tu phob //
analyzed: rin chen bdud rtsi'i char gyi char rgyun drag tu phob //
translated: and let fall a heavy rain of the nectar of jewels.游댷You obtained the kingdom through Indra's laughter,游댷Lakshmi through Vishnu's mere glance,

original: khyod ni rgod pas brgya byin gyis ni rgyal srid dang // spyan zur tsam gyis khyab 'jug gis ni dpal mo dang // mnyes pas dbang phyug gis ni gangs ri'i gnas kyang thob //
analyzed: khyod ni rgod pas brgya byin gyis ni rgyal srid dang // spyan zur tsam gyis khyab 'jug gis ni dpal mo dang // mnyes pas dbang phyug gis ni gangs ri'i gnas kyang thob //
translated: and the abode of Kailash through Shiva's favor.

original: mgon po sdug phongs 'gron bu tsam yang mi ster ram //游댷'gro ba'i dbang phyug rnams la dpag med bde ba rnams //
analyzed: mgon po sdug phongs 'gron bu tsam yang mi ster ram // 'gro ba'i dbang phyug rnams la dpag med bde ba rnams //
translated: O Lord, do you not give even a mere cowrie to the poor?游댷To the lords of the world, you always give immeasurable happiness,

original: rtag tu khyod ster sdug bsngal can la de lta min //
analyzed: rtag tu khyod ster sdug bsngal can la de lta min //
translated: but not to the suffering.

original: khyod kyis sngon ma mthong ba snying rje'i yul gyur pa'i //
analyzed: khyod kyis sngon ma mthong ba snying rje'i yul gyur pa'i //
translated: How can you fear the poor, the objects of compassion,

original: dbul ba'i sdug bsngal can la ji ltar khyod 'jigs sam //
analyzed: dbul ba'i sdug bsngal can la ji ltar khyod 'jigs sam //
translated: whom you have never seen before?

original: nor gyis nor slong gus ldan rnams la khyod 'gengs kyi //
analyzed: nor gyis nor slong gus ldan rnams la khyod 'gengs kyi //
translated: You satisfy the respectful who beg for wealth with wealth,

original: yang dag skal med sdig byas rnams la khyod min zhing //
analyzed: yang dag skal med sdig byas rnams la khyod min zhing //
translated: but not those who are unfortunate and sinful.

original: nor gtong nor gyis nor ldan par ni 'dzin gyur te //
analyzed: nor gtong nor gyis nor ldan par ni 'dzin gyur te //
translated: You are considered to be a giver of wealth, a possessor of wealth,

original: mgon po slod ba'i tshogs rnams nges par spong byed dam //
analyzed: mgon po slod ba'i tshogs rnams nges par spong byed dam //
translated: but do you not abandon the hosts of those who are in need, O Lord?

original: gal te khyod kyis nor gtong rnams la khyod kyis ster //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis nor gtong rnams la khyod kyis ster //
translated: If you give to those who give,

original: skye bo tsheg ngan rnams la ji ltar khyod 'jigs sam //
analyzed: skye bo tsheg ngan rnams la ji ltar khyod 'jigs sam //
translated: how can you fear those who are evil?游댷Listen to me, O king of the yakshas,

original: rab tu 'bad pas nges par smra ba de yis mchog / gnod sbyin rgyal po bdag gis gsol ba gsan du gsol //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pas nges par smra ba de yis mchog / gnod sbyin rgyal po bdag gis gsol ba gsan du gsol //
translated: I speak with great effort.

original: rab tu 'bad byas de 'dra'i nor dang ldan gyur nas //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad byas de 'dra'i nor dang ldan gyur nas //
translated: Having become so wealthy through great effort,

original: ji ltar @85b dbul po'i sgra ni thos par ma gyur cig //
analyzed: ji ltar @85b dbul po'i sgra ni thos par ma gyur cig //
translated: how can I not hear the word poor?

original: dbul po'i me ni rab tu 'bar bas 'gro ba rnams //
analyzed: dbul po'i me ni rab tu 'bar bas 'gro ba rnams //
translated: The world is burning with the fire of poverty,

original: sreg par nges mthong yid kyis ngo mtshar nyid du gyur //
analyzed: sreg par nges mthong yid kyis ngo mtshar nyid du gyur //
translated: Seeing this, the mind is amazed.

original: gang zhig bdag gis smras ba'i tshig rtsub tshig rnams ni //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag gis smras ba'i tshig rtsub tshig rnams ni //
translated: The harsh words that I have spoken

original: chu yi dbang pos brtse phyir 'di rnams bzod par mdzod //游댷gang zhig bstod pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: chu yi dbang pos brtse phyir 'di rnams bzod par mdzod // gang zhig bstod pa 'di yis ni //
translated: May the Lord of the Waters forgive out of compassion.游댷Whoever always praises Jambhala

original: rtag tu 'bad pas dzam la bstod //游댷des ni dbul por mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bad pas dzam la bstod // des ni dbul por mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: With this praise,游댷Will never be poor

original: shin tu mi g-yo'i dpal thob shog //
analyzed: shin tu mi g-yo'i dpal thob shog //
translated: And will attain unwavering glory.

original: mi'i dbang po nyi ma rnam par gnon pas dzambha la la bstod pa mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mi'i dbang po nyi ma rnam par gnon pas dzambha la la bstod pa mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The praise of Jambhala by King S콞ryavam콑캐kara is complete.

original: // / kaly'a na mi tra gzhon nu shes rab bkyis bskul nas /
analyzed: // / kaly'a na mi tra gzhon nu shes rab bkyis bskul nas /
translated: Encouraged by the young Kaly캐攷ㅡmitra Praj침캐k캶rti,

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dharmma dh'a ra dang yar lungs pa grags pa rgyal mtshan gyis dpal sa skya'i gtsug lag khang du bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dharmma dh'a ra dang yar lungs pa grags pa rgyal mtshan gyis dpal sa skya'i gtsug lag khang du bsgyur ba'o//
translated: The Indian abbot Dharm캐dhara and Yarl칰ng Phakpa Drakpa Gyaltsen translated this at the glorious Sakya temple.
